name: Bounded Prime Gaps (Zhang/Polymath)
description: Prove Zhang's theorem: there exists H such that infinitely many consecutive primes differ by at most H. Zhang showed H ≤ 70,000,000; Polymath improved to H ≤ 246.

insights: Proof requires Selberg sieve, GPY sieve methodology - neither formalized in any theorem prover
Bombieri-Vinogradov theorem (equidistribution of primes in APs) not in Mathlib - critical dependency
Kloosterman sums and exponential sum bounds needed - requires Weil conjectures machinery
Mathlib HAS: Dirichlet characters, L-functions, von Mangoldt function, prime counting, Dirichlet's theorem
Repository axiomatizes Zhang's result in Erdos5PrimeGaps.lean but cannot prove it
Zhang's proof is 50+ pages of dense analytic number theory combining multiple techniques
Polymath8 involved dozens of mathematicians coordinating to optimize constants
2026-01-19 CONFIRMED: Selberg sieve and Bombieri-Vinogradov NOT in Mathlib
2026-01-19: Zulip discussions show sieve methods are a future goal, not completed

2026-01-19: Vaughans identity needed before B-V can be formalized
